meanings.definition: Below an expected or desired standard.
meanings.sent1: The movie received subpar reviews from critics.
meanings.sent2: Her subpar grades in math class were a cause for concern.
meanings.sent3: His attempt at baking a cake turned out subpar, resembling a pancake instead.
meanings.sent4: The team's subpar performance on the field cost them the championship.
meanings.sent5: The subpar condition of the old house made it difficult to sell.

meanings.sent1: The subpar headphones broke after just a few uses.
meanings.sent2: The restaurant received complaints about their subpar service.
meanings.sent3: The subpar imitation designer bag fooled no one with its poor quality.
meanings.sent4: Her subpar singing skills made her hesitant to join the choir.
meanings.sent5: The subpar paint job on the car left streaks and uneven coverage.
